chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Crapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert L Crapp is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert L Crapp was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 15CF1565.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted.$1569  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing and functioning IID.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's copy of Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations returned.  No forwarding address. (15CF1331, 15CF1565, and 15CF1706).
Reporter: Heather Kieta - Plea/Sentencing Hearing 10-20-2015

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Letter to def. Correct amount owed is $1569.00
Associated with Charge #3

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.
Leave on trial calendar
Final pre-trial at 09-21-2015 03:00 pm

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $2,000 per case for a total of $2,000. All other previous bail conditions remain set. Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
BMP Violation Report 2
Bail Monitoring Program Follow Up Report
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by Plaintiff

Ct. addressed defn's bail violations as reported by Bail Monitoring. Defn ordered to provide PBT-if defn tests positive for any alcohol, defn. will be terminated immediately from BMP; Court added condition of bond that the Defendant is not to consume or possess controlled substances without a valid prescription

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not possess of consume controlled substances without a valid persecription.
- Defendant shall not be at any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale or consumption of intoxicants.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 4:00 PM today.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge -  Br 5

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:50
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Thomas A. Nelson.  Shaun W O'Connell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Atty T Nelson

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Diane Louise Schlipper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
